intro: Securidaca cayennensis, commonly known as the Cayenne Securidaca, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
